entry.et: Middle English belle, from Old English; perhaps akin to Old English bellan to roar bellow

def.dt: :a hollow metallic device that gives off a reverberating sound when struck
:doorbell
:the sounding of a bell as a signal
:a stroke of a bell (as on shipboard) to indicate the time
:the time so indicated
:a half hour period of a watch on shipboard indicated by the strokes of a bell see ship's bells table below
:something having the form of a bell: as
:the corolla of a flower
:a bell-shaped organ or part (as the umbrella of a jellyfish or the dewlap of a moose)
:the part of the capital of a column between the abacus and neck molding
:the flared end of a wind instrument
:a percussion instrument consisting of metal bars or tubes that when struck give out tones resembling bells usually used in plural
:glockenspiel
:to provide with a bell
:to flare the end of (as a tube) into the shape of a bell
:to take the form of a bell :flare
:to do a daring or risky deed

entry.et: Middle English, from Old English bellan

def.dt: :to make a resonant bellowing or baying sound the wild buck bells from ferny brake Sir Walter Scott
:bellow roar
Alexander Graham 1847–1922 Am. (Scot.-born) inventor
city SW California SE of Los Angeles pop 36,664
:pants with wide flaring bottoms
:a buoy with a bell rung by the action of the waves
:captain 2c
:normal curve
